    <item> 
      <title>The 91-year-old politician who is still fighting</title>  
      <description>The BBC's Geeta Pandey explains why M Karunanidhi, 91, continues to be a political force in Tamil Nadu state.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-36253790#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-36253790</guid>  
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 23:15:21 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Four India cities among most polluted</title>  
      <description>India has four of the 10 cities in the world with the worst air pollution, the World Health Organisation says.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-36283743#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-36283743</guid>  
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 06:22:26 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>VIDEO: Indian artisans feel strain of beef ban</title>  
      <description>India supplies about 20% of all the beef in the world. But it's a topic of fierce political and religious debate.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36283536#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36283536</guid>  
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 01:47:46 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>India to require licence for map apps</title>  
      <description>India is introducing legislation to ban any maps or satellite images of the country unless they are approved by government.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-36276754#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-36276754</guid>  
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 13:03:53 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>ICC appoints first independent chairman</title>  
      <description>The International Cricket Council (ICC) appoints India's Shashank Manohar as its first independent chairman.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/cricket/36273972</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/cricket/36273972</guid>  
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 07:02:58 GMT</pubDate>  
      <media:thumbnail width="66" height="37" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/1D48/production/_89669470_manhoar3_getty.jpg"/>  
      <media:thumbnail width="144" height="81" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/4458/production/_89669471_manhoar3_getty.jpg"/> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>VIDEO: Cattle slaughter ban hits Indian farmers</title>  
      <description>India is the world's biggest exporter of beef but a ban on cow slaughter in many states has severely affected the lives of cattle farmers.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-36254504#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-36254504</guid>  
      <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 23:01:37 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Modi mocked over Somalia remark</title>  
      <description>Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's comparison of southern Kerala state with Somalia angers politicians and social media users.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-36264001#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-36264001</guid>  
      <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 07:37:23 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Lawmaker's son held for road rage death</title>  
      <description>Police in India's Bihar state say they have arrested the 20-year-old son of a lawmaker suspected of killing a student in a road rage incident.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-36253789#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-36253789</guid>  
      <pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 04:19:37 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>India asks UK to extradite Vijay Mallya</title>  
      <description>India will seek to extradite indebted business tycoon Vijay Mallya after the UK rejected its request to deport him, the Indian finance minister says.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-36264006#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-36264006</guid>  
      <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 09:41:27 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>India Hindu group prays for Trump win</title>  
      <description>Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump has gained some unlikely fans - including a right-wing Hindu group in India that is praying for his victory.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-36273568#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-36273568</guid>  
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 06:52:03 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Indians 'swipe left' on desi Tinder ad</title>  
      <description>In a new advertisement, Tinder suggests that even Indian parents approve of the dating app - but social media users aren't convinced.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-36264101#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-36264101</guid>  
      <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 08:55:14 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>India's comic 'super hero' rape survivor</title>  
      <description>A new comic book with a female rape survivor as its "super hero" is being launched in India to focus attention on sexual violence, writes the BBC's Geeta Pandey in Delhi.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-30288173#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-30288173</guid>  
      <pubDate>Mon, 08 Dec 2014 00:47:19 GMT</pubDate>  
      <media:thumbnail width="66" height="49" url="http://news.bbcimg.co.uk/media/images/79448000/jpg/_79448353_priya_no_shadow.jpg"/>  
      <media:thumbnail width="144" height="81" url="http://news.bbcimg.co.uk/media/images/79448000/jpg/_79448354_priya_no_shadow.jpg"/> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>The children of Bhopal bear scars of gas leak</title>  
      <description>Nazes Afroz travels to the central Indian city of Bhopal to photograph the children born after the poisonous gas leak from the Union Carbide factory on 3 December 1984.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-30227852#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-30227852</guid>  
      <pubDate>Tue, 02 Dec 2014 21:21:39 GMT</pubDate>  
      <media:thumbnail width="66" height="49" url="http://news.bbcimg.co.uk/media/images/79367000/jpg/_79367410_pic4.jpg"/>  
      <media:thumbnail width="144" height="81" url="http://news.bbcimg.co.uk/media/images/79367000/jpg/_79367411_pic4.jpg"/> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>In pictures: India's gun-violence widows</title>  
      <description>Photographer Karen Dias meets the families of those allegedly killed by the security forces in the north-eastern Indian state of Manipur and documents their stories.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-29042486#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-29042486</guid>

      <media:thumbnail width="144" height="81" url="http://news.bbcimg.co.uk/media/images/77352000/jpg/_77352083_img_9507_kd_01.jpg"/> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>In pictures: India's dying printing tradition</title>  
      <description>The centuries' old system of letterpress printing - involving arranging letters by hand and printing on treadle machines - is being kept alive in the Indian city of Calcutta.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-29123688#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-29123688</guid>

      <media:thumbnail width="66" height="49" url="http://news.bbcimg.co.uk/media/images/77905000/jpg/_77905008_p04.jpg"/>  
      <media:thumbnail width="144" height="81" url="http://news.bbcimg.co.uk/media/images/77905000/jpg/_77905009_p04.jpg"/> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>In pictures: Mass protests at Jadavpur University</title>  
      <description>Students at Calcutta's Jadavpur University have been protesting for the past fortnight over the sexual assault of a female student. Photographer Ronny Sen has been to the university to find out more.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-29322789#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-29322789</guid>

      <media:thumbnail width="66" height="49" url="http://news.bbcimg.co.uk/media/images/77761000/jpg/_77761035_02.jpg"/>  
      <media:thumbnail width="144" height="81" url="http://news.bbcimg.co.uk/media/images/77761000/jpg/_77761036_02.jpg"/> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>In pictures: Life in denuded India villages</title>  
      <description>Sohrab Hura's images of a cluster of villages in India which has been denuded after deforestation.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-28190259#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-28190259</guid>

    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>In pictures: Deadly Kashmir floods</title>  
      <description>The worst floods in Indian-administered Kashmir in half a century have killed at least 150 people and left Srinagar under water, as residents are evacuated or retreat to their rooftops.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-29105658#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-29105658</guid>

      <media:thumbnail width="144" height="81" url="http://news.bbcimg.co.uk/media/images/77442000/jpg/_77442703_77442571.jpg"/> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>In pictures: India's coal miners</title>  
      <description>Photographer Arindam Mukherjee follows some coal miners going about their work in eastern India.</description>

    <item> 
      <title>In pictures: India's Ambassador taxis</title>  
      <description>Images of India's Ambassador taxi which was named by the world's best taxi by BBC's Top Gear.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-24045086#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>

    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>In pictures: 'Pellet guns' maim Kashmir protesters</title>  
      <description>Security forces in Indian-administered Kashmir are increasingly using non-lethal weapons to quell protests, but these guns are causing serious injuries to protesters and bystanders.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-27917522#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-27917522</guid>

      <media:thumbnail width="144" height="81" url="http://news.bbcimg.co.uk/media/images/75669000/jpg/_75669143_aijazahmad_001.jpg"/> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>In pictures: One year after India floods</title>  
      <description>Photographer Mansi Thapliyal visits the temple town of Kedarnath, one of the worst affected areas during last June's devastating floods in Uttarakhand state.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-27775328#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>

    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>In pictures: India's ancient city of Varanasi</title>  
      <description>Photographer Harikrishna Katragadda chronicles India's holy city of Varanasi.</description>

    <item> 
      <title>In pictures: World Cup fever grips India</title>  
      <description>Images of World Cup fever that has gripped the Indian city of Calcutta.</description>

    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>In pictures: Life in an Indian camp for riot-displaced</title>  
      <description>Aarabu Ahmad Sultan's images of life in the camps set up for people who fled their homes after 65 people died in the Hindu-Muslim clashes in India's northern town of Muzaffarnagar in September.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-25547206#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>

      <media:thumbnail width="144" height="81" url="http://news.bbcimg.co.uk/media/images/71995000/jpg/_71995700_mn(17).jpg"/> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>In pictures: Delhi's 'little Africa'</title>  
      <description>Photographer Ronny Sen documents life in the Khirkee Extension area of Delhi which has been in the spotlight in recent days after a minister raided a house there, accusing its inhabitants - four Ugandan women - of being involved in prostitution and drug trade.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-25908797#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>

    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>In pictures: Life of an Indian runaway boy</title>  
      <description>Photographer Arindam Mukherjee spends a month documenting the life of 13-year-old Sheikh Alamgir who ran away from home at seven and lived at a railway station in Calcutta for six years.</description>

    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>In pictures: Life along Kashmir border</title>  
      <description>Abid Bhat's pictures of life on the de facto border between India and Pakistan in disputed Kashmir.</description>

    <item> 
      <title>In pictures: Kashmiri saffron</title>  
      <description>Photographer Abid Bhat travels to a saffron field in Indian-administered Kashmir to see how saffron, the world's most expensive spice, is harvested.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-25184341#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>

    <item> 
      <title>In pictures: India in 2013</title>  
      <description>BBC Online looks back at the big events of 2013 in India in photos.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-25489977#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-25489977</guid>

      <media:thumbnail width="144" height="81" url="http://news.bbcimg.co.uk/media/images/71953000/jpg/_71953674_71920380.jpg"/> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>In pictures: India craze over Tendulkar farewell</title>
